title: Listed under accessories

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of two-channel video, color, sound; 34 min. 12 sec.; edition 3 of 4, plus 1 artist proof.

artist_display:
Dave McKenzie
American, born Kingston, Jamaica, 1977
medium_display: Two-channel video, color, sound; 34 min. 12 sec.; edition 3 of 4, plus 1 artist proof
credit_line: The Alyce and Edwin DeCosta and the Walter E. Heller Foundation Endowment Fund and The Gladys N. Anderson Fund
publication_history:
David Breslin and Adrienne Edwards, curators, Whitney Biennial 2022: Quiet is It’s Kept, exh. cat. (New York: Whitney Museum of America Art, 2022), 174, 175 (color ill.), 178, 179 (color ill.).

Peter Brock, “The American Predicament of the 2022 Whitney Biennial,” Frieze, May 10, 2022 (color ill.), https://www.frieze.com/article/whitney-biennial-2022-review

CQS Redaktion, “Dave McKenzie is Part of the 2022 Whitney Biennial at the Whitney Museum of American Art (New York),” DEEDS.NEWS The Art Newspaper from Berlin, Mar. 31, 2022 (color ill.), https://deeds.news/2022/03/dave-mckenzie-im-whitney-biennial-2022-whitney-museum-of-american-art-new-york-06-04-05-09-2022/

Kerr Houston, “Not to Eat But to Think: The 2022 Whitney Biennial,” BmoreArt, May 27, 2022 (color ill.), https://bmoreart.com/2022/05/not-to-eat-but-to-think-the-2022-whitney-biennial.html

Amy Irish, “The 2022 Whitney Biennial spotlights video artists who are pusing the medium forward,” The Art Newspaper, Apr. 25, 2022, https://www.theartnewspaper.com/2022/04/25/2022-whitney-biennial-video-artists

Dina Ramadan, “80th Whitney Biennial, ‘Quiet as It’s Kept’,” e-flux Criticism, Apr. 5, 2022, https://www.e-flux.com/criticism/460215/80th-whitney-biennial-quiet-as-it-s-kept
exhibition_history: New York, Whitney Museum of American Art, Whitney Biennial 2022: Quiet is It’s Kept, Apr. 6–Sept. 5, 2022, no cat. no. (exhibition copy).
provenance_text: The artist; sold through Barbara Wien Gallery & Art Bookshop, Berlin, to the Art Institute of Chicago, Apr. 11, 2023
